accent.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
accent.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He had a strong Irish accent.
accent.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the part of a word that you should emphasize when you say it
accent.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: In the word ‘dinner’ the accent is on the first syllable.
accent.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a written mark used above or below particular letters in some languages to show how to pronounce that letter
accent.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The man had a Spanish accent.

The woman had a Chicago accent.
I got a call from a man with a foreign accent.
He spoke with a lovely soft southern accent.

a tall man with a posh accent
I could detect the hint of a German accent in her voice.
accent.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it
accent.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Use make-up to accent your cheekbones and eyes.
accent.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to emphasize a part of a word in speech
